definition: to burst open/to split at the seam

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The flower comes out in early spring.
Flowers expanded their petals in the sunshine.
Mountain terraces, moved, farmers uncle opened smiling face.
sentences.chinese: 山间的梯田里，麦浪滚滚，农民伯伯绽开了笑脸。

sentences.english: She wiped her eyes, and a slight smile began to crease her tear-stained cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 她擦了擦双眼，一丝微笑在她满是泪痕的脸上绽开。

sentences.english: The sky appears a red sun, like the blooming roses.
sentences.chinese: 天际出现了一抹紫红色的朝晖，像绽开的红玫瑰。

sentences.english: Flowers blooming, life is so divine.
sentences.chinese: 丛花绽开，生命是如此的神奇。

sentences.english: Death's flowers bloom in the sober eye.
sentences.chinese: 死亡之花于他清醒的眼中绽开。

sentences.english: The next year, Lotus Lake, the blooming beauty of a blossoming lotus.
sentences.chinese: 第二年，莲花湖上，绽开了一朵朵美丽的莲花。

sentences.english: Her dress is so tight the seams are bursting.
sentences.chinese: 她的外衣这么紧身，缝口绽开了。

definition: tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
to burst open/to split at the seam
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
(of a woman, a flower etc) delicate colors
to raise one's head/to perk up
